title: Film, specifically Sin City
content:
Don't know if anyone has seen this movie, but it positively rocks. It certainly beats out The Saw, which was the last movie I saw, and also a piece of crap. Sin City did this awesome black and white thing with bits of color and overdramatized constantly. It also presented things very simply to go along with the fact it was based on a comic book. And of course, it was overly violent to the point of being undeniably fun. Dismemberments and blows the head galore.

Also, I would like to take this moment to say how much I hated Kill Bill. That is just if no one saw Sin City to comment on it, maybe they can agree with me that Kill Bill really really sucked. Expecially that second one where there was no blood.*** --- I Am Keen is hell bent for leather. Are you? --- ***

title: Re: Film, specifically Sin City
content:
I took a while before cinema showed the movie in the Netherands but it was certainly worth the wait.
This is probably the most original and therefore the best movie in years.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/upload/logo/image_multijpeg/DevilFrogVerwandlung.jpg[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jiw/img/US_logo_big.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: hmm
content:
I wouldn't necessarily call it "original" so much as "most accurate and faithful to a comic book style." As far as originality goes, there was a surprisingly athletic nerd, a corrupt church official, a refridgerator-sized man who could absorb a rediculous amount of damage, a hooker with a heart of gold, a deadly female assassin, and a cop on the verge of retirement... those aren't really original, y'know? :-)

(Still an awesome and bold movie)[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: hmm
content:
The characters aren't really original, nor is the story. But the way of filming, with all the black and white, surreal backgrounds was certainly something I've never seen before.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/upload/logo/image_multijpeg/DevilFrogVerwandlung.jpg[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jiw/img/US_logo_big.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: hmm
content: I've seen a trailer and now can't wait for this movie. It looks simply amazing. I need to wait for few weeks to see it here, though. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: hmm
content:
bump, just watched it for the first time, really liked.

the broken plotline between eleven-year old Nancy Callihan being saved and eight years later was the one bit of Quentin Tarantino i thought i saw. because i don't pay enough attention to detail, i completely missed how Nancy was in the intervening story until right then (basically, if you're dumb enough, you get a really cool shock) that's probably why i have an elevated opinion of the movie. although, if you look at the "yarn" timeline in wiki, it's kinda sad: Mirv's story is actually at least 3 years after Hartigan's, so Nancy's existence in the former implies her survival in the latter - and, imo, what a decadent existence it must have been! Right now, it feels sadly to me like Nancy's life had climaxed with Hartigan's story - but we are supposed to find out more in Sin City 2.[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote][img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/3852/sheepsmall0sf.jpg[/img]
[url=http://trailers.apple.com/trailers/independent/blacksheep/trailer/]trailers.apple.com/trailers/independent/blacksheep/trailer/[/url]

title: Re: hmm
content:

And if not you can read the comic for that matter, they're awesome.-----------------
